intro: Diplacus bicolor, commonly known as the hummingbird flower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features striking, showy flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, with a distinctive two-toned appearance. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky habitats. Diplacus bicolor is a popular choice for gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like hummingbirds.
